models.activityTypes: Categories of ecosystem activities for filtering.
models.activities: Individual ecosystem events, workshops, and research initiatives.
models.womenFounders: Dedicated Women Founders support program details.
models.testimonials: Participant testimonials for the Women Founders program.

relationships: Activities occur in a specific Country with coordinates for map display
Women Founders program has multiple Testimonials from participants
Some Activities link to Studies in the Toolbox

activities.title: Pan-African AI Summit
activities.description: Flagship networking event bringing together AI practitioners, investors, and policymakers from across Africa to discuss the future of AI on the continent.
activities.fullDescription: The Pan-African AI Summit convened 300+ participants from 15 African countries for two days of keynotes, panel discussions, and networking. Topics included AI ethics, funding landscape, and cross-border collaboration. The event featured a startup pitch competition with €50,000 in prizes.

activities.title: AI Readiness Study Launch
activities.description: Launch event for the comprehensive AI Readiness study conducted across 8 African countries with partner Briter Intelligence.
activities.fullDescription: This research initiative surveyed 500+ startups across 8 countries to assess AI adoption barriers, infrastructure readiness, and skill gaps. The findings inform policy recommendations and program design for AI4Startups initiatives.

activities.title: Women in AI Bootcamp - Accra
activities.description: Intensive 5-day bootcamp for women entrepreneurs building AI-powered solutions, featuring technical training and business mentorship.
activities.fullDescription: This bootcamp supported 30 women founders with hands-on AI/ML training, product development workshops, and one-on-one mentorship sessions. Participants received cloud credits and ongoing support through the Women Founders network.

activities.title: Data Governance Workshop
activities.description: Two-day workshop on data governance best practices for AI development, co-hosted with the African Union.
activities.fullDescription: Legal experts, technologists, and policymakers gathered to discuss data protection frameworks, cross-border data flows, and ethical AI guidelines. The workshop produced a set of recommendations for harmonizing data governance across African nations.

activities.title: Francophone AI Meetup
activities.description: Quarterly meetup series for French-speaking AI practitioners in West Africa.
activities.fullDescription: The Francophone AI Meetup brings together developers, researchers, and entrepreneurs from Senegal, Côte d'Ivoire, and neighboring countries. This edition featured demos of locally-developed AI models and discussions on NLP for African languages.

activities.title: Women Founders Pitch Day - Lagos
activities.description: Pitch competition for women-led AI startups with €30,000 in prizes and investor introductions.
activities.fullDescription: Fifteen women founders pitched their AI startups to a panel of investors and industry experts. The event included pitch coaching, investor networking, and follow-up mentorship for all participants.

activities.title: AI Ethics Roundtable
activities.description: Expert roundtable on ethical considerations for AI deployment in African contexts.
activities.fullDescription: Ethicists, technologists, civil society representatives, and government officials discussed bias in AI systems, algorithmic accountability, and culturally-appropriate AI design. The roundtable produced an ethics checklist for African AI developers.

activities.title: Women in AI Conference - Kigali
activities.description: Two-day conference celebrating women in AI across Africa with keynotes, workshops, and networking.
activities.fullDescription: The inaugural Women in AI Conference brought together 200 women technologists, entrepreneurs, and researchers. The event featured keynotes from leading African women in tech, technical workshops, and a career fair with partner companies.

activities.title: AI for Climate Research Launch
activities.description: Launch of research initiative on AI applications for climate adaptation in Africa.
activities.fullDescription: Partnership with climate scientists to explore how AI can support drought prediction, flood early warning, and agricultural adaptation. The research covers Kenya, Senegal, and Morocco with findings to be published in 2026.

activities.title: Developer Bootcamp - Cairo
activities.description: Week-long intensive bootcamp training developers on machine learning fundamentals.
activities.fullDescription: Fifty developers participated in hands-on training covering Python, TensorFlow, and practical ML applications. The bootcamp prepared participants for AI4Startups hackathons and provided certificates recognized by partner companies.

womenFounders.title: Women Founders Program
womenFounders.tagline: Empowering women entrepreneurs to lead Africa's AI revolution
womenFounders.description: The Women Founders Program provides targeted support for women building AI-powered startups across Africa. Through bootcamps, mentorship, funding access, and community, we're closing the gender gap in African tech.

programElements.title: Bootcamps
programElements.description: Intensive 5-day programs combining technical AI training with business development.

programElements.title: Mentorship
programElements.description: One-on-one mentorship from successful women founders and tech leaders.

programElements.title: Funding Access
programElements.description: Pitch opportunities, investor introductions, and grant access.

programElements.title: Community
programElements.description: Ongoing peer support through the Women Founders Network.

testimonials.quote: The bootcamp gave me the technical skills and confidence to pitch my AI startup. Within 3 months of completing the program, I raised my first funding round.
testimonials.name: Amara Diallo

testimonials.quote: The mentorship was transformative. My mentor helped me navigate the investor landscape and connected me with my first enterprise customer.
testimonials.name: Chioma Okonkwo

testimonials.quote: Being part of the Women Founders Network means I'm never alone. We share challenges, celebrate wins, and support each other's growth.
testimonials.name: Grace Muthoni

testimonials.quote: The program opened doors I didn't know existed. I went from a side project to a funded startup with enterprise clients.
testimonials.name: Fatou Sow
